title: Synthetic Recap
body:
SACRAMENTO – On a night when defense was optional and the rim must have looked as wide as the ocean, Mitch Richmond authored a performance for the ages, single-handedly shooting the Sacramento Kings to a thrilling 114-110 victory over the San Antonio Spurs.

Richmond was simply unstoppable, pouring in a career-high and franchise-record 47 points in a breathtaking offensive display. From the opening tip, the Kings' guard was in a relentless rhythm, slicing through the Spurs' defense and firing from deep with equal precision. His scoring barrage was the engine of the Sacramento offense, leaving a talented San Antonio squad scrambling for answers all night.

The Spurs, led by the formidable frontcourt duo of David Robinson and Tim Duncan, fought valiantly. Robinson muscled his way to 26 points and 16 rebounds, while the rookie Duncan added a stout 20 points and 13 boards. But for every Spurs run, Richmond had an answer. A timely three-pointer, a driving layup through contact, or a silky jumper from the elbow—his 47 points were a masterclass in shot-making under pressure.

In the game's final, frantic moments, it was Richmond who iced the victory from the free-throw line, coolly sinking the shots that sealed his historic night and the hard-fought win for the Kings. His 47-point eruption wasn't just a win in the standings; it was a legendary chapter in the Sacramento record books, a night where one man’s brilliance eclipsed everything else on the court.
